meanings.definition: The quality of being convenient and practical despite possibly being improper or immoral.
meanings.sent1: The expediency of taking a shortcut saved us time and effort.
meanings.sent2: He chose expediency over honesty in order to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent3: The expediency of using a fake ID to enter the club was risky but effective.
meanings.sent4: Her expediency in bending the rules to get ahead eventually caught up with her.
meanings.sent5: The expediency of lying to cover up his mistake only made the situation worse.

meanings.definition: A means of achieving a particular end, especially one that is convenient but possibly improper or immoral.
meanings.sent1: The expediency of bribery was his go-to method for getting what he wanted.
meanings.sent2: In politics, expediency often trumps ethics when making decisions.
meanings.sent3: Using expediency to cut corners may lead to short-term gains but long-term consequences.
meanings.sent4: The expediency of using loopholes in the system to avoid taxes is a common practice.
meanings.sent5: She relied on expediency to get ahead in her career, regardless of the ethical implications.
